Entry.1:
Left Liverpool camp 2pm, paraded Moore Park, sailed 12 noon.

calm sea, church, nothing exciting. choppy sea, half men sick, slightly, but not sick.

Rough and squally, crockery rolling off tables, and men falling over and down the stairs with the tucker.

Big gale water over top deck. Frank had sticks in face a day in the Australian Bight, life belt parade, boy died from exposure,
posted letters to ElseMrs Dixon. Then T. Rich Uncle Flo

Calm sea, guard 12 hours, calmuneventful day. Last of Auscoast seen Cape in
wireless news of war & coal strike wrote Mrs Towser J Dixon.
